title: Question 6
prompt:
If the Prefect told the narrator that Dupin had been acting very strangely, what would the narrator most likely think?

The narrator might think that
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
When the Prefect calls Dupin’s habit of sitting in the dark to think an “odd notion,” the narrator says that the Prefect calls everything “odd” that he doesn’t understand. If the Prefect said Dupin was acting very strangely, the narrator would probably think that the Prefect just didn’t understand Dupin’s behavior.


“That is another of your odd notions,” said the Prefect, who had a fashion of calling every thing “odd” that was beyond his comprehension, and thus lived amid an absolute legion of “oddities.”
